featured.text: Dolphins, like us, have to breathe air.
According to fitness trainers, physically 36 exercises may make you breathe heavily and your muscles may ache temporarily, but exercise should not be painful.
It’s tempting, when breathing the thin air of Bekoji, to focus on the special conditions of the place.
Some scholars theorize that onions may have been used for the dead because it was believed that their strong scent would 40 the dead to breathe again.

other.text: The astronauts can hardly breathe in a space suit.
When they are __36__ in the nets too long, they cannot breathe.

definition.zh_def: 呼吸，指吸入空氣並排出二氧化碳的過程。
definition.en_def: To take air into the lungs and then expel it, a vital process for living organisms.
definition.example: She took a deep breath before speaking in front of the crowd.
